website_summaries.verdict: The professional adhesive remover to get adhesive off of delicate surfaces like cars and trucks.
pros: 4-inch wheel attaches to any everyday drill to make adhesive removal quick and simple
The removal wheel has a light touch, making it safe to use
Will not gouge or scratch acrylic, enamel, or urethane paint work
cons: The eraser has mixed results on some tough-to-remove adhesives like decals

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Didn't work at all for the left over double sided tape on my Excursion. Tried it on the body and the trim piece itself and it just doesn't do anything. Update... was using this on a very tired old drill. Popped it onto my new Dewalt and it went to town on devouring the left over tape and adhesive. Highly recommend now and would really recommend over the similar one by 3M that costs more.
customer_reviews.author: Romanova

customer_reviews.title: Magic!!  Before and After Magic
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this very nice looking Dodge Challenger. Friends that saw it said, "I wouldn't have purchased a car with the ugly stripes!!!" This was nearly universal. The Rubber eraser along with a blow dryer made quick work of the stripes, eliminating the stripes entirely in under 90 minutes. Best $10.00 investment ever! The rubber eraser wheel removed the glue that the blow dryer left behind. I had previously received a quote from a detailer to have the stripes removed and replaced with another for $1200.00 Granted, it did include installing a new set of stripes, but I prefer not having a stripe anyway. Checkout the before and after images for more inspiration.
customer_reviews.author: SWW

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Chemical engineers are remarkable, who ever designed this little wheel should be heralded and loved by the masses. This just flat out works. With this one wheel, I was able to remove the pin striping from my one ton Dodge king cab truck, and still enough material to remove a 3 foot by 4 foot faded vinyl graphic from the nose of my travel trailer. Whether the surface is steel or fiberglass this takes the vinyl off with no damage to the paint underneath. I found that a plug in drill worked the best to remove the material, more consistent than a battery drill.
customer_reviews.author: M. Parr

customer_reviews.title: Does not damage paint
customer_reviews.text: I used this to remove the 3M double sided automotive moulding tape from my car's side skirts. It worked perfectly! I used a DeWalt corded drill and spun all the pieces off. I was originally using a plastic chisel, then a wood chisel, goo gone, heat etc. This did the trick in the end and saved me a TON of headache. The only major downside is the amount of rubber eraser scraps you get after having a go at it. It will get everywhere and require cleanup. The eraser takes a little getting used to, but once you get the technique down it is hands down worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Furinax

customer_reviews.title: The best/gentle adhesive remover
customer_reviews.text: I had thick decal adhesive left behind on my trailer. Used Googone, 3m adhesive remover, paint thinner, denatured alcohol, and many other adhesive removers. They either weren't strong enough or they were too strong and stripped my thin paint. I tried everything This rubber wheel saved my trailer. I was able to take off all the decal adhesive WITHOUT taking off the paint! It took some time but worked great. Make sure your drill is up to the task. I used a Milwaukee and it was fine on the lower speeds. Dont use a high RPM or you might burn the paint. This wheel also works great on removing the actual decals aswell.
customer_reviews.author: Felterstuff

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times before posting anything and now I give it 5 stars! I removed the vinyl sticker on my hood from my 12 year old mini and a few other stickers. I removed the sticker or vinyl the best I could then hit it with this and it worked wonders. Well worth what I paid. If you buy this thinking you can hit the vinyl a lone with this and be fine then you will be disappointed. If it's small like pin stripes then think you're good, but I had 5" wide stripes so that's not ideal for this.
customer_reviews.author: TurboRabbitTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but take notice....
customer_reviews.text: The eraser worked great in getting the factory adhesive off the back tailgate of my truck. Try your best to keep the surface of the edge flat against the paint. In a few spots I used the hard edge and it left some yellow residue behind... no big deal for me as I installed a new emblem over it, but if you're using it to "de-badge" a vehicle take a little extra time and a little less pressure and you should be good.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Judy

customer_reviews.title: DON’T USE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cut through the paint on my truck!!! Don’t buy unless you are really wanting to have to get a paint job! Luckily I stop to check on it after about 8 inches but now I have 8 inches of torn up paint! I was using the slowest speed and it tore right through the paint.
customer_reviews.author: G. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 3m VHB tape removal
customer_reviews.text: I only have used this for one purpose so far, removing what seemed like a mile of 3M VHB tape from the roof of my van. (If you aren’t familiar with VHB it is a super strong sticky double sided tape, which in my case holds solar panels on my roof at highway speeds. Works great but crazy difficult stuff to remove.) This did the job, removing every bit of tape and residue, while doing no harm at all to the paint. Although use consumes the rubber of the wheel, it lasted a surprisingly long time and got the job done with plenty left over wheel for future use.
customer_reviews.author: StealthLS2

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye pin stripe. Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple of months ago and it sat on my counter because I have two small kids and no time to do anything else. I hated the pin stripe that came with my truck but was too worried about messing up my paint when trying to take it off. But this wheel was super easy to use and did a great job. The first pin stripe took a little more time to get the hang of how to use the tool. The second pin stripe only took a few minutes to get it off. Be warned that After you use the tool, you will have more yellow powder on your floor than a corn grinding factory.
customer_reviews.author: jason deaver

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: This decal remover worked very well. So much so I ordered a second one. Once I saw the results and for the price. Now while using this product keep in mind that it's rubber. As you using it breaks down due to the friction. So there will be residue to clean up afterwards. It's a a little bit messy, but the ease of removing vinyl pinstriping. Just remember that the use of friction and rubber is being used. So it's going to smell, it's going to get hot and there's going to be some mess. It will remove what you want to take off. Just don't be in a rush.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus V.

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a lot longer than I was expecting it to, removed all the brand badges off my "dodgr ram 3500 cummins turbo diesel 4x4 heavy duty slt" and ys, thats how many badges were on there. Also was able to remove the adhesive for the bumper strips on the lower portion of the cab, removed some stickers off the windows along with some mystery gunk off the window, and some stubborn something off the chrome bumpers. Do not use on plastic, it'll melt and leave a mark. Otherwise, super great, did all of this with 1 broken shoulder, easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Skjerpen

customer_reviews.title: Great for fiberglass boat!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to remove 32 year old vinyl pin strips off a 23 foot fiberglass boat and it worked very well. Took the vinyl and adhesive off like it was nothing and left no marks or damage to the gel coat. Did stop occasionally to let the wheel cool down as it does start to get very hot. Compared to the price of the 3M one I’m glad I took the chance on this one. WOULD buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It works, but takes work
customer_reviews.text: Had two quarter inch old pin stripes that would not come up by hand. This eraser wheel did the trick. But the videos I watched had the wheel going in parallel with the stripe but I had to go perpendicular as my electric drill did not have enough clearance from the car hood. It leaves rubber residue which after using air hose to blow off as much as I could I then needed to use 3M adhesive remover to get the rubber residue completely off. Left micromarring (and yes I went as light as touch as possible) so be prepared to use a light compound/polish afterwards, but I got all marring off. Overall a good tool/works - just be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: DGNC

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Eraser Wheel Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: Had two-sided tape on vehicle that was used to attach a rain vent. Vent came off and left the tape. Other products couldn't touch the adhesive used to attach these things. Wheel on a battery drill removed this without effort and without damaging my truck. It makes a mess, but can't complain. I bought this after working for more than an hour and getting nowhere with adhesive removers. This wheel made removal child's play. Awesome. I don't think you need to name brand when this works as well as it does.
customer_reviews.author: We are Normal

customer_reviews.title: Removed twelve year old trim tape with ease
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is awesome. I removed some side trim from my 2007 Suburban that left some old crusty adhesive from the double sided tape. There was about 30 linear feet of gross residue to remove and this wheel took care of it in less than an hour. It took a few minutes to find the best technique. Once I figured it out, it just went. Left a lot of eraser residue but that just washed off with a hose. Got sticky residue to remove from a painted surface? This is your solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Worrells

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but a lot better that anything else I have found
customer_reviews.text: I have had to remove a few logos from company vehicles when we sell them. It is usually a monumental pain that takes forever. We have had no luck trying to hire someone else to remove them. While the logo eraser isn't easy, it is the most efficient method I have found. It took about a quarter of the time compared to removal without it. You will need a corded drill or lots of batteries for your cordless drill depending on the size of the logo. Some polishing is required afterwards to remove vinyl smears.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: It works, holy cow something works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wish I took pictures but on my sons truck, a widow Guard broke and he was going to replace it. It was held on by double sided tape. He pulled the old one off but the double sided tape stayed. We tried goo begone, wd40 all different internet suggestions before someone told me about this. Ordered and 5 minutes after delivery it was done. Easy to use, ran it from my cordless drill, just a little bit of pressure and removed the tape and didnt hurt the paint on the truck. This is a must have for everyone’s tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H@VABEACH

customer_reviews.title: JUNK !! JUNK !! JUNK !!
customer_reviews.text: All I needed to remove wrer the Ohio St. boat stickers and numbers off a 12 year old boat I purchased. This thing removed 3 letters and it was shot! Followed instructions, actually watched a u tube video as well so I'm absolutely certain I used it correctly (this isn't rocket science!). Anyway, can't send it back now and I can only conclude that Ohio stickers are unbelievably tough?? I live in GA.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Schlomm

customer_reviews.title: Don't run it too fast on fiberglass
customer_reviews.text: I used this to take some numbers and decals off a boat I bought. First time using one of these things, I ran it too fast and burned my fiberglass slightly, discoloring it from white to a light tan (coincidentally the same color as the eraser). You don't need to run it fast. The side load it produces is also hard on your drill, so don't push too hard. If you have a crappy drill you might burn it up if you have a lot of removing to do. All that said, it really does work.
customer_reviews.author: PatC

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfect on Truck Door Trim
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2010 GMC and wanted to remove the trim/bumpers on the door. I was a little worried that it might damage the paint given the age of the vehicle but I did a test area and it worked perfect. I was able to remove the actual trim with fishing line, then hit it adhesive with the eraser. I went back through with a little bit of Goo Gone to clean everything up. On a 4 door truck I probably spent 1.5 hours start to finish. Insanely quick compared to the amount of time I have spent doing it before.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Adams

customer_reviews.title: Decal Adhesive, Now You See It, After This You Don’t.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in very simple packaging, two pieces, the wheel and the bit to use with the drill. Of course, don’t judge a book by its cover. Used this to remove last of vehicle decal residue. Took off the adhesive within five seconds of touching to it. The whole thing took less than a minute and that was because I was being cautious and thorough. I’d buy it again, however, I used so little of it...this will last me a while.
customer_reviews.author: Telecom Herk

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what others are doing, but this worked great for me! My car was repainted, with a decal pinstripe. After reading some reviews, is was worried about burning through the paint, beings it wasn't factory. But it worked awesome! People were also saying that they don't hold up. I have a little Miata, but I could had removed the pinstripe 4 times over. The price is great as well. About 1/2 of what it is at the auto parts stores.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cillo

customer_reviews.title: Worked amazing
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It does take a minute to get used to the "feel" of using it. If you use the edge or press to hard it will mess the paint up. Luckily for me I was taking the decals off to repaint anyway. It wears down kinda fast but it was enough to remove the decals and stripes all the way around my 14ft mirror craft boat. It's 39 yrs old and they were cracked and baked on but it stripped them right off with a little time and effort
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Greenthumb

customer_reviews.title: Most useful and economical
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a vehicle at an auction and it had decal glue all over it. I tried everything I could find including gasoline to remove it and nothing would work. I contacted a shop and they recommended some decal glue remover which was almost 100 dollars per gallon. Put this on my battery drill and a couple of hours later the paint looked completely clean. I probably have enough life on it to do another entire car with what is left.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Did the job perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wheel to debadge my 2019 Ram decals. Popped it onto my cordless drill and went to town. This thing worked very well. Didn't leave any marks on my paint and completely removed even some stubborn adhesives. I wore it down quite a bit with all that I needed it to do but it's definitely worth the money. Made the job so much easier than some other methods I've seen. Would 100% purchase another if I ever needed to.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for old decals
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to remove 27 year old factory decals from a single stage paint job (1990 Toyota). It is far faster than a razor blade and heat (mostly because of the age of the decal). There has been no damage to the paint. I have used about half of a wheel on the decals on the bed, I suspect one wheel will finish about 2/3 of my truck. I was dreading this job and finding this tool has made it pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is "wheely amazing"
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me hours of manual labor. Literally. I connected this sucker to my drill and removed dried up mounting tape leftover from vent visors over four windows within 30 minutes. I had so much time leftover, I went around the house and looked for other things to use the wheel on. I removed some scuffs on my front door, some pen markings on my kitchen table and a tattoo of an ex girlfriend's name on my right forearm. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Takes off adhesive but is horrible for your paint
customer_reviews.text: I would give it zero stars but I can’t. I ordered this to take off the adhesive left behind by my factory badging. It takes off the adhesive but it left my paint all scuffed even after cleaning the spot throughly before. If you don’t care about your paint go ahead and use it but if you want your paint to be okay afterwards don’t use it. I figured it would be better than having blisters on my fingers from using my fingers to roll it off. I have reconsidered my opinion after looking at my paint.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate- BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: This little wheel did wonders removing the strips of double sided tape that adhered the side panel trim pieces of my '99 Jeep Cherokee. The tape was meant to stubbornly keep it's hold for the life of the vehicle, which it definitely was doing; nothing I used (goof off/ plastic scraper/ etc) would effectively remove it. The ABN rubber wheel made short work out of this frustrating project. It took every bit of goop and residue off my vehicle without even the slightest bit of damage. If you are on the fence about this, buy it! It's well worth the twelve bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I used this wheel on a recommendation from a friend to remove residue from an old beaching bumper on my fiberglass boat. I've done another like this without the wheel and it was an awful job by hand. The wheel made it much easier and a much better and cleaner removal with no chance of damaging the fiberglass. This was still not an easy job, but the wheel did most of the work for me. Highly, Highly recommend, at least for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Savage

customer_reviews.title: Light touch required
customer_reviews.text: does pretty much what it advertises it will do. It does leave a lot of residue and powder. If you press to hard it will go to bare metal.. Use a battery drill and it will go dead in about 10 minutes. Use a corded drill if you have one. The drill will get frickin hot so i would strongly recommend using gloves plus the gloves will help your gripe on the drill . It will try to walk off on you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Removed sun baked vinyl on fiberglass gel coat on a 26 year old motor home nothing else would do it, I have used up two and expect to use two more. after my second wheel, I calculated that they remove 16.5 square feet of vinyl each, I timed the second wheel, it took me 2-1/2 hours to do 16 square feet (or about 8" strip 28 feet long) including multi layers and complete cleanup with some real sticky adhesive buildup.
customer_reviews.author: Mt

customer_reviews.title: The best way to get off stubborn vinyls
customer_reviews.text: After 10 years getting baked onto the paint, the hood stripes on my Mini were pretty stuck on. No amount of chemical dissolvers, heatgun, etc would remove them. The rubber eraser wheel attached to a drill made quick work of the decals. You should be aware that there is a high likelihood of marring your paint while using this - as you'd expect. If you're planning to do a paint correction afterwards it's not a big deal, but if not you will add marring and swirls to your paint.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Eraser Wheel!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ABN eraser wheel as an economical alternative to 3M and it worked great! I used it to remove leftover adhesive residue from 6 yr old vinyl racing stripes on my Dodge Challenger. I spent half a day removing the residue the old fashion way of bug and tar remover, goo gone, alcohol, and plastic scraper and quit. I needed a more efficient way and the eraser wheel arrived fast and removed the residue with ease only using a household corded drill with max 1500 rpms. I found using the drill at lower speeds helps with control. I would definitely recommend this item and save the elbow grease.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove the 30 year old decals from my Toyota Dolphin. Let me tell you, the buggers are baked on from years in the sun. I bought one to try it out. It lasted long enough to remove half the decals so I'll buy another one. This worked very well for me and it was very easy to use. My ugly decals are slowly going away. YAY! This removed the decals from both paint and fiberglass without marring the surfaces. Maybe it's due to the age, but it didn't leave any gummy residue. It took everything off.
customer_reviews.author: rootessa

customer_reviews.title: Left melted residue to be removed by other methods
customer_reviews.text: I used this wheel to try removing old paint protection film on my front trunk. The film and adhesive was removed but the wheel left a smeared, melted residue that had to also be removed by other methods. The wheel wear was rapid, for a four inch by 18 inch strip, the wheel reduced about 1/8 of it's diameter. I stopped using the wheel after that strip removal. You may find other videos that show removal by a similar wheel, but this one did not perform similarly.
customer_reviews.author: Phong Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed to remove some faded pin stripping from my car along with some other tape residue . I've used a more expensive eraser wheel and it worked great for this type of job. I figured Id take a chance on a much less expensive one and see how it worked . I was not disappointed . It worked great and at a fraction of the cost of other ones. Id definitely buy it again when this one wears out .
customer_reviews.author: Ynot

customer_reviews.title: Prob best amazon purchase ive made for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used this to remove lg pinstripes that have been on the car probably for 10 years . Was hesitant at first because people said there was paint damage before so tried everything with credit card, goo gone and whatever else you can think of. What a waste of time, this thing worked so fast and there was no damage whatsoever. Don’t worry about a screw gun spinning too fast, most don’t have enough RPMs to meet half of the max rpm. It took me one for a razor to remove two large pinstripes in the hood all the way to the back and two on the side of my Mustang
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: A REAL Affordable Eraser Wheel
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this eraser wheel! I'm a former body shop owner and used eraser wheels often. This wheel is as good of quality as the high dollar 3M we used in the shop. There 2 things people do wrong when using a wheel like this...one is to much RPM and the other is to much pressure against the decal they are trying to remove. Used correctly this wheel is a super value.
customer_reviews.author: TOMMY G.

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: Unit works pretty well, but takes a while to get the hang of it. Tighten it snugly and know that when you back off of work surface, it's spinning may cause it to unscrew from the adapter. Sometimes I had the wheel inline and sometimes across the work. If you are working with plastic be careful, because if you are just using the edge, it can easily and quickly dig a groove.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Krauth

customer_reviews.title: Buy the 3M wheel.
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Yes. Are there better products? Yes. Should you spend more money and get the better product even though it's 3x the price? In a heartbeat. Get the 3M Stripe remover, sure, it's $30-something bucks, but better product. This thing stinks, it's a rubber wheel that burns when you use it, it's send hot chunks of whatever you're removing flying at you. Like a dummy I didn't have on safety glasses and almost lost an eyeball. The molten rubber left by the wheel is not easy to get of. The product was just overall an unpleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: bwilliams

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Great price on this eraser wheel. I bought it to take the decals off my 5th wheel. Unfortunately, after a nice stretch of warm weather, its gotten very cold and snowy so I haven't really had a chance to put this wheel to the test. I did try it for a few minutes and it worked reasonably well. The temp that day was just too cold to give it a really good try. I am giving it the benefit of the doubt and will update when I can.
customer_reviews.author: E. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Work like a charm....
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2016 Smart forTwo that was a "Car to Go" in a former life.... had a black vinyl wrap on TOP of a blue vinyl wrap... Black came off with sun and heat gun.... The Blue was there for life..... ABN Eraser Wheel made quick work of the Blue vinyl and the adhesive under it .... the underlying silver paint looks like new....... Took two for my job ....
customer_reviews.author: D. Hitch

customer_reviews.title: Is this wheel a joke?
customer_reviews.text: The second the wheel touched my car it ripped the clearcoat and paint right off, now i have a problem. Should have used an adhesive remover rather than a rubber wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph  mcdonnell

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Quickly removes decals from automobiles. Took the police decals off my Crown Victoria way fast where everything else failed. Wheel lasts far longer than expected. Just wish that the shaft had flattened sides as it tended to slip in my power drill before I cut some grooves into it. Must be careful on bumpers as the heat can quickly melt gouges and around weather stripping and soft rubber as the eraser will quickly cut through them.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Now you see it, now you don't!
customer_reviews.text: I used a buddy's eraser wheel a few years ago and it worked really well for de-badging my truck. This time around I wanted to purchase one for the same thing on a new Rav4. This wheel worked better than the one I borrowed. I used 12# fishing line to remove the badging and then the eraser wheel to remove the adhesive and local dealership stickers, then wiped down with a terry clothe rag and packed up the tools. It was done...it only took 5 minutes, start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: RDH

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: It did not work very well for me. I was using it on 10 year old vinyl graphics that varied from 1" to over 6" wide. It did remove the vinyl, but it was slow and messy. On a positive side, the fiberglass below the graphics was not damaged. A heat gun with a plastic razor blade scraper worked better. Goo-Gone took the remaining adhesive off.
customer_reviews.author: OD Cleaver

customer_reviews.title: It really works.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to remove the flaking pinstripe from my 2007 Mazda. This wheel on my cordless drill does the job. Just remember, don't bear down too hard on one spot and let that particular spot get too hot. That will cause the yellow wheel to leave a yellow stain in that area. Keep it moving and make several passes rather than try to get it all off at once.
customer_reviews.author: J Mack

customer_reviews.title: A possible last resort.
customer_reviews.text: These , I would only recommend as a almost last resort . I’ve taken many old graphics off out here in the blistering desert . I’ve found it overall much faster to use a heat gun and peel off , or if the graphics are cracked , heat and peel using plastic razor blades . The eraser wheels do remove graphics quite easily but leave a hard rubber residue that I’ve found takes way to long to remove and typically requires acetone and wet sanding to remove entirely . I’d say though , taking off multiple thin pinstripes could be a bit faster with the wheel . My advice ... experiment a bit before committing to either.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This rubber wheel worked perfect for removing the decals from the side of my boat. It rubbed it of and did not damage the paint finish. I have a 22’ boat and I used 2 rubber wheels. I screwed it to my cordless drill. I used a dust mask because the rubber wheel leaves a residue that can be easily inhaled. I wiped off the residue with a dry rag.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent! I usually just use goo gone and a heat gun on small applications but this was a bit larger of a job. This did not disappoint. What would normally take 90 minutes to 2hrs of work was done in about 15-20 minutes. Removed 80% of the residue, mine still required goo gone and a microfiber to completely remove all adhesive. Waxed and buffed afterwards and you could never tell anything was there before. A must have for the tool chest.
customer_reviews.author: 0311 D.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: One of the worse products I've ever purchased. Within the first 5 seconds of using the wheel it damaged a very large portion of my car. I tend to be ocd about my vehicles and not enjoy scrateches. This mean I also don't like 3M tape on my car. I used this product to try and remove the 3 m tap. It destroyed my door without taking off the 3M tape. In the picture attached I removed most of the tape myself, except the underlayer. I was going to use this product to finish up the car. Needless to say I am horrified by what happened.
customer_reviews.author: forrest paul

customer_reviews.title: Dont listen to other reviews saying it does because they used it like a damn sander
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I was skeptical on using this thing on my truck. The main concern was striping the clear coat off or even the paint. But I can promise it does neither of these things if used correctly. Dont listen to other reviews saying it does because they used it like a damn sander. Attach it to your drill, apply pressure and SLOWLY spin the wheel against the adhesive material. Comes right off. After removing the majority of adhesive I followed up with goo be gone and a wash. Can hardly even tell there was 17 year old adhesive cooked on there.
customer_reviews.author: Camden

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: Used to take off remnants of double sided tape after removing the factory roof rack. Leaves a bit of a mess but easy clean up, it's basically a giant spinning pencil eraser. Steady constant pressure with a back and forth movement on the adhesive seemed to work best. If using a cordless drill make sure it's well charged, effectiveness drops exponentially with loss of torque when the battery starts to die.
customer_reviews.author: Luke M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great value compared to 3M. Worked wonders. I remember when I had to rub my fingers thru the double sided tape YEARS ago. Those days are over with this rubber eraser wheel! Made quick job, each leftover residue from the badges were gone within a minute each! Just attach to your drill and have at it! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy T

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, keep your pressure in check.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in my cordless drill. Wears evenly and doesn’t dig too much if you keep it flat on the project. Can build heat if you really get aggressive, so pace yourself. I used it on leftover adhesive from my Ram after I removed the badges. I don’t remember the original size but I used maybe a 1⁄4” off the total diameter doing all the badges but the Cummins emblem.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool for sticker removal
customer_reviews.text: Works great on those pesky dealership decals they always slap on in the worst spots. Or any other decals you wanna take off. Just go slow and mind the heat so you don’t burn the paint.
customer_reviews.author: Lowery70

customer_reviews.title: Extreme danger!!! Not for white paint!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this wheel to remove the adhesive after de-badging my brand new white VW Tiguan. As other reviews said it left yellow residue where it removed the adhesive. No solvent was able to get it out. I ended up having to aggressively a buff it out with car polish and a Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stergiotis

customer_reviews.title: Slow and steady,no paint damage
customer_reviews.text: It wore more than I expected but it completed my job and half of it is left. I cleaned up around 21 ft of 1/4 inch tape that was 1/8 inch thick. Best part it never marked or burnt the paint. It took experimenting for the drill speed and pressure to do the work efficiently. Slow rpms is the key for what I did, very slow.
customer_reviews.author: john vanous

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Wheels
customer_reviews.text: I like to detail my rims, however some shops don't clean off the old adhesive from the stick on weights. That adhesive will collect dirty and just make the rim ugly. This tool cleans off the old adhesive and didn't harm the paint, however just don't hold it in one place too long for that could damage the paint.
customer_reviews.author: dworthy

customer_reviews.title: at least it worked
customer_reviews.text: I was originally going to give this 2 stars because it took quite a bit of time and force to remove the pinstripe from my car, but then I bought the 3M wheel which was entirely ineffective so this gets 3 for at least working. What worked well was the item at the below link. I will be leaving them 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Elven Banzon

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for removing 3M two-sided tape from auto panels. What previously would have taken me an hour with WD40 or goo-gone took me about 5 minutes with this wheel. And, the finish of my paint was completely unaffected. It took a little to determine the best speed and pressure to use, but once I got that down this wheel was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.

customer_reviews.title: Go slow and it is great.
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot and was concerned about leaving a yellow stain. Took all of a minute to remove 8 year old sun baked decal ony RV. If you go too fast it burns yellow on paint. Put Milwaukee 18v on low speed and no problems. I liked it so much I just ordered two more. When I finish I will post before and after photos on second review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for old decals & stripes
customer_reviews.text: I liked this decal eraser so much I stopped part way through the job to write this review. I have a 20 year old boat with 20 year old striping. The striping is starting to crack and peel so its time to remove it and replace with new stripes. I tried using a heat gun to scrape off the old decals, and acetone to clean the glue. While that method works great on relatively new decals, on old vinyl like mine, the decal won't peel off it just comes off in little bits. This eraser works great, what a work saver, and it also takes off the old glue. I wish I had it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G

customer_reviews.title: Works, buy it
customer_reviews.text: This thing works, and works very well. I used it to remove the 3M tape for rain guards around the windows and it was a breeze. Did not damage the paint at all. One note DO NOT let it touch rubber trim, it will instantly dig into rubber and leave a mark, I tried to remove some of the tape on the rubber trim and found this out the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality rubber, not worth the lower cost.
customer_reviews.text: I started stripping decals off of our camper with a 3M wheel, but at $32 each I was looking for a more economical solution. This isn't it! The wheel even says 4" on the packaging, but is only 3.5" in diameter. That's a LOT of decal removing. They do not strip as cleanly as the 3M wheels as the rubber seams much harder. Disappointed in this product, I just ordered 2 more 3M wheels to finish my job.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Lappie

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this eraser wheel I had never used one before and I was using to take a double pinstripe off of a friends car. The wheel was so easy to use! It took me about 30 minutes to complete the job and it looks great! With the amount of the eraser wheel left, I could easily do at least 1 more car (Chevrolet Impala). Would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: R. House

customer_reviews.title: Obliterated in 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Obliterated after about 10 minutes of use. Was working fine then it blew apart nearly damaging my door. The mandrel is cheap and it some how bent. First 3 minutes the wheel spun off of the mandrel which was odd because it should be tightening itself as it spins not loosening. After it blew apart I still can find the third piece. Processed a return and getting my money back to pony up and get the 3m one to finish my doors on my truck.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure what the negative comments are, this wheel is very easy to use and works great if you have the tiniest amount of common sense! Used to rip off my pinstripes on my car! 1 rubber disk, whole car. One side literally took me 20 minutes, then i used a little goo-gone to finish the job! I could probably do 4 more cars with this disk.
customer_reviews.author: keith ricci

customer_reviews.title: Great eraser wheel
customer_reviews.text: These are as good as the more expensive 3m ones. I have been using eraser wheels for years and decided to give these a shot. Ill save a lot of money now over the 3m brand ones i have been using. They work great.
customer_reviews.author: TheOneThatIsn't

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace the hull numbers on my fiberglass Pro-Line boat and didn't want to damage the gel coat. This eraser wheel worked way better than I expected. In a matter of minutes, I had all the hull numbers off, the areas cleaned with alcohol and was ready to put the new numbers on. No damage to the gel coat.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great product, becomes lopsided during use but did not damage the paint or anything.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastically, for a lot less than the 3M version. It took two of these to remove the adhesive left behind from removing the stainless kick panels. The truck is a crew cab short bed. Deducted one star because both wheels became lopsided during use, not sure why, happened on two different drills. The first side took 4 hours to complete (including removing the kick panels with a heat gun), the second took just over two. Absolutely no damage to the paint. A little wax and Good to go.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing on fiberglass
customer_reviews.text: Here are pics of before and after using the whizzy wheel on my 34' RV with fiberglass sides. I used a standard 3/8" drill to accomplish the job...again, works amazing, but to avoid fatigue I recommend using a buffer to do the job. Also, try to play with the rotation speed. I found that a lower speed with a little more pressure was more affective. The higher the speed the more likely the "smear" of the decal. Either way, there was no damage to the surface of the vehicle. Hope this info helps you finish your job....
customer_reviews.author: alberto vigil

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for removing old car pinstriping
customer_reviews.text: Used this to remove pinstripping off of my 15 year old SUV. Worked perfectly and didn't damage the paint. I used a rechargable drill and went at a angle at a slower revolution. Saved me hours of tedious work, as it only took about an hour. Just take your time and don't let it get too hot by using too fast of a drill speed. Still have over 50% of the wheel left after removing all the pinstripe off my SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had an emblem on the back of my truck. I used fishing line to remove it but of course the paper with the adhesion was still there. In about 5 mins, this had removed any trace of the emblem. You do not have to have a high RPM. Let the product and drill do the work. In between I would spray with glass cleaner and wipe away to see where I had missed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Turner Sr

customer_reviews.title: Works great to remove stickers and decals from automotive paint
customer_reviews.text: Works great removing stickers and decals from paint. It will make the mess of a 1,000 erasers in less than a minute! I made the mistake of removing some stickers from a motorcycle frame in the living room, there was no way to kick the mess around enough to act like nothing happened!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: This eraser is amazing! I attached to my Milwaukee cordless drill, and proceeded to take the 18 year old adhesive left behind by those terrible rain/air vent awning things that some people put over the car windows. 10 minutes, done! Also took off the dealer decal from my wife’s car in about 15 seconds. Just goooooood!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roblez

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but care is needed.
customer_reviews.text: The product removed old deteriorated vinyl graphics, but first wheel flew apart. When using it is very important to watch how much the wheel expands and adjust rpms to avoid wheel failure. May not be an issue with a drill, but with an air die grinder I had to use an inline regulator to slow it down.
customer_reviews.author: Lothar

customer_reviews.title: Right tool for the job!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect. Had pin striping down the side of my suv. Hated the look. Started taking it off manually but it kept ripping every two inches. Huge pain in the butt. Unfortunately I don’t have any photos because once I started using it it works so well and was actually fun to use. Went right into my battery powered drill and it took no more than five minutes to do my entire car. Loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Worked, but be careful, it builds a lot of heat
customer_reviews.text: I used this wheel to remove decals from atv plastics. It worked ok, but it built a lot of heat, damaging the plastic in a couple of places. It also left a LOT of residue that was difficult to remove. Maybe it works better on paint, but I would be cautious of burning the paint.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works same as 3M for less $$
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2003 Silverado that some fool put gmc side trim on years ago. I peeled it off and these wheels handled the residual foam adhesive with no issues. These are a fraction of the price of 3M brand and perform the same. It surprisingly lasts longer than I thought. I bought 2 and only needed one. I decided to attacking a crusty cracked dried out rhino lining sticker on the tailgate and this wheel removed that too. I’ll definitely buy these Abkhazian if I need to and I highly recommend them as a lower priced version of a 3M.
customer_reviews.author: C.Burms

customer_reviews.title: Tricky. Good for some things not others
customer_reviews.text: I tried using the wheel to remove a large area of clear film on the rear wheel well of my HHR. Where I had already scraped and there was little glue the wheel seemed to work well but very slow. In areas where there was a lot of glue it just made a big mess. When using the wheel below the main car body on some plastic trim below the door, the wheel ate up the paint badly. I will have to replace the entire piece. Maybe this is created for small decals and pinstripes but I didnt have success in my particular case. I'm back to heat gun and Goo Gone.
customer_reviews.author: Showe

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS ONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the wheel you want. Used this one on some vinyl stripes and it removed them cleanly, effectively, and fast without scuffing or damaging my paint. Unfortunately, this one wore down before i was done and i bought another one, but not this same one. It was a Sumex Rubber Eraser and let me tell you, DO NOT GET THAT ONE! Ripped clearcoat and paint off my car. Did hundreds of dollars of damage to it. I was so pissed when i realized i didn't get this same rubber wheel that i had before. If you need a good one, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Wow love this wheel!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this thing rocks. I decided to try it out since its not too expensive. I have removed decals before and it's always a tough long ordeal which usually ends in me giving up. This thing is fast and works amazing. Make sure your drill is charged all the way it works much better. My vehicle is black so no issues with staining. What can i say i love this wheel now, wont remove any decals without it.
customer_reviews.author: Vanisher187

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove the pin stripes on my GMC Yukon. Took me 10 minutes to do the entire vehicle. I am sure the 3M product is excellent as well and probably lasts longer, but for $10 this is made the job and absolute dream. I could probably do 20 vehicles with this. It also removed all the adhesive at the same time. Five stars all day long.
customer_reviews.author: M V

customer_reviews.title: It works!  Removal of stripes on truck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to remove red striping on a 94 truck that has seen plenty of sun. The heat gun method wasn't budging the stripes, but this took it right off. Takes a bit to get used to holding a spinning wheel on a surface, but once you get the hang of it, it goes pretty smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Le Nez

customer_reviews.title: Took off the sticky stuff but left rubber residue
customer_reviews.text: I'll probably stick with using denatured alcohol to remove pine sap and other stuff from deciduous trees because I had to use it anyway after this to remove the rubber residue left behind. I hope this doesn't leave the same residue when removing decals or bumper stickers.
customer_reviews.author: KJV

customer_reviews.title: Keep an open mind of the tools for the job.
customer_reviews.text: The wheel works excellent in the removal of stickers and the glide. I would also recommend getting the plastic razor blades and holder. This was a must in removing what couldn’t be removed with the wheel. Both are excellent products. I have a 36’ fifth wheel with lots of stickers that needed replacement and could not have been done in a reasonable time and effort without the wheel, plastic blades, heat gun and paint thinner as it isn’t as harsh to the surface as lacquer thinner. I was really impressed with the wheel on the removal of those stickers. I would recommend the wheel to speed up the process of the removal and a professional job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works! Caution it gets hot after using it non stop for a while
customer_reviews.text: does as it says did very well removing factory pinstripe on my 20 year old truck..it does leave a slight bit of residue but with a little alcohol and elbow grease it comes out...i managed to get the pin stripe off around my entire f250 but depending how much you have to remover maybe buy another to give one a chance to cool off here and there as to mine warmed up a few times just put it down for a few mins and picked it back up
customer_reviews.author: berto

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations! Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove the double sided adhesive on side molding pieces that were coming off on my truck. On the last piece I discovered the ( insert expletive) that owned the truck before me used a 2 part epoxy to reattach the molding. After scrapping and scrubbing I hadn’t removed hardly any of it. I thought the decal eraser worked so good on the 3m stuff, why not try, I’m desperate. It worked really well. I had to use at a very high rpm but it really did work. This is my experience with this great little tool. I bought 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Kristophe

customer_reviews.title: Will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Man why I lasted so long in not buying this product is beyond me! Makes life so much easier! Just make sure you don’t rub your forearm while applying pressure to remove the decal, pin stripping because just as easy as it removes these thugs it’ll do the same to your skin,, lmao.🤣🤣
customer_reviews.author: WS62002

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: The window visors on our hhr needed to be replaced and we had difficulty getting the double sided tape off the car. Tried several things then my husband saw this. It worked really well and removed the double sided tape fast and easily. It was well worth the purchase. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: RLA

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great removing baked on decal residue. 80% of the actual decals on my project had already been removed, but had left lots of residue and impressions. One of these ABN rubber eraser wheels cleaned 2 big truck doors and appropriately 14 feet by 3 inches of striping residue from the vehicle. I still have 3/4 of the wheel left for a future project.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me. Removed 8yr old adhesive double sided tape easily.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works perfectly fine for removing old adhesive double sided tape from a window vent that was on the car for 8years. I washed the area with dishsoap and a microfiber towel, dried it off then went to town. It works anywhere u have room to use it. I see myself getting more.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schuepfer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but does a lot of smearing
customer_reviews.text: I used this to attempt to remove some old pinstripes from a car and found that the rubber would smear the adhesive quite a bit. Changing the angle that you're using this at seems to help, but it's definitely not as effective as the ad might lead you to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Artur S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have our company vehicles covered in Vinyl decals. the large sheets come off with ease but the individual lettering is hard to get off and very time consuming. I purchased the eraser wheel and removing the individual lettering takes no time at all. This is one of the best time saving items i have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Deteriorates fast
customer_reviews.text: Deteriorates very fast and leave a huge mess. Product worked fine removing thin adhesive from the Yukon XL badge. When trying to remove adhesive from a door trim panel, it took off some and left a majority behind causing more work to remove. I ended up using a heat gun to slowly peele off the rest and solvent to clean the residue
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a long time and did a nice job
customer_reviews.text: I used this to remove left over adhesive from body side moulding on a full size truck. It did a great job and lasted long enough to get it all done. I still have about 1/3 left on the wheel. I would definitely buy one of these again. I used it on a dewalt cordless drill and it worked fine. No special equipment required.
customer_reviews.author: BigDog

customer_reviews.title: Took decal adhesive off easily
customer_reviews.text: I had goofy 90s decals on my truck that were starting to give up the ghost, along with the toyota decals on my tailgate that were half gone. Took them off with a heat gun but very stubborn adhesive was left. Goo gone failed to do the job. This thing blasted the adhesive off without messing up the paint. Very happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

product_meta.title: ABN Rubber Eraser Wheel 4in Pad & Adapter 1-Pack – Pinstripe, Adhesive Remover, Vinyl Decal, Graphics Removal Tool
feature_bullets: OBLITERATE DECALS: Use the ABN Rubber Eraser Wheel Adhesive Remover with Adapter 1-Pack to remove any vinyl, decal, graphic, double-sided molding tape, striping, and trim on your car, truck, or similar vehicle; 4-inch (10.2cm) diameter (larger than others!); Molded rubber medium density drill attachment tool with a stop use line; For use with electric drill with maximum 4,000 RPM (best results between 1,500 and 3,000) (Not for use on lacquer coatings and not effective on some reflective tapes)
BETTER DESIGN: Solid round design is larger in size than other discs which makes this wheel fast, easy to control, plugs up less during use, and stays cool

SAFE: Will not gouge or scratch acrylic enamel or urethane paint work; No need for dangerous and harmful chemicals; The wheel has a durable construction that withstands up to 4,000 RPM; The included 5/16” 24 hardware makes it compatible with any standard drill

EASY TO USE: Apply light pressure starting at the top of the decal and moving side to side, or for faster results, use entire width of the wheel without tilting or angling; Remove any residue with appropriate mild solvent; Always use proper protective equipment when using power tools
CONTENTS: Package includes (1) 4-inch round decal eraser wheel and (1) 5/16” 24 thread drill adapter arbor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,064 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
